intro: Armeria maritima subsp. gaditana, commonly known as the Iberian thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant produces dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found along the Atlantic coast. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
